angiotensin  ||  noun a polypeptide which affects blood pressure by causing vasoconstriction and increasing extracellular volume comment :  the precursor protein , alpha - 2globulin is converted to angiotensin i , which is inactive .  a converting enzyme changes angiotensin i into the active form , angiotensin ii  .  drugs which block the conversion to the active form , ace inhibitors , are used in the treatment of hypertension and heart failure .  
angiotensin - converting enzyme inhibitor  ||  noun a drug which inhibits the conversion of angiotensin i to angiotensin ii , which constricts arteries , used in the treatment of hypertension and heart failure .  also called ace inhibitor ( note :  ace inhibitors have names ending in  - pril :  captopril .  ) comment :  contraindications include use with diuretics , when hypotension can occur and should be avoided in patients with renovascular disease .  
angle - closure glaucoma  ||  noun an unusually high pressure of fluid inside the eyeball caused by pressure of the iris against the lens , trapping the aqueous humour .  also called acute glaucoma 
angular stomatitis  ||  noun a condition of the lips , mouth and cheeks characterised by cracks and fissures and caused by a bacterial infection 
angular vein  ||  noun a vein which continues the facial vein at the side of the nose 
anhedonia  ||  noun a psychological condition in which a person is unable to enjoy all the experiences that most people enjoy 
anhidrosis  ||  noun a condition in which sweating by the body is reduced or stops completely 
anhidrotic  ||  adjective referring to a drug which reduces sweating 
anhydraemia  ||  noun a lack of sufficient fluid in the blood 
anhydrous  ||  adjective referring to compounds or crystals that contain no water 
anhydrous alcohol  ||  noun same as absolute alcohol 
anidrosis  ||  noun same as anhidrosis 
aniridia  ||  noun a congenital absence of the iris 
anisocytosis  ||  noun a variation in size of red blood cells 
anisomelia  ||  noun a difference in length of the legs 
anisometropia  ||  noun a state where the refraction in the two eyes is different 
ankle  ||  noun the part of the body where the foot is connected to the leg d he twisted his ankle , he sprained his ankle he hurt it by stretching it or bending it 
anklebone  ||  noun same as talus 
ankle jerk  ||  noun a sudden jerk as a reflex action of the foot when the back of the ankle is tapped 
ankle joint  ||  noun a joint which connects the bones of the lower leg ( the tibia and fibula ) to the talus 
ankyloblepharon  ||  noun a state where the edges of the eyelids are stuck together 
ankylose  ||  verb to fuse together , or to cause bones to fuse together 
ankylosing spondylitis  ||  noun a condition occurring more frequently in young men , in which the vertebrae and sacroiliac joints are inflamed and become stiff 
ankylosis  ||  noun a condition in which the bones of a joint fuse together 
ankylostoma  ||  noun same as ancylostoma 
ankylostomiasis  ||  noun same as ancylostomiasis anll abbr acute nonlymphocytic leukaemia 
annular  ||  adjective shaped like a ring 
annulus  ||  noun a structure shaped like a ring 
ano -  ||  prefix referring to the anus 
anococcygeal  ||  adjective referring to both the anus and coccyx 
anodyne  ||  noun a drug which reduces pain , e.g.  aspirin or codeine adjective referring to drugs that bring relief from pain or discomfort 
anomalous  ||  adjective different from what is usual 
anomalous pulmonary venous drainage  ||  noun a condition in which oxygenated blood from the lungs drains into the right atrium instead of the left 
anomaly  ||  noun something which is different from the usual 
anomie  ||  noun a psychological condition in which a person develops the feeling of not being part of the everyday world , and behaves as though they do not have any supporting social or moral framework 
anonychia  ||  noun a congenital absence of one or more nails 
anopheles  ||  noun a mosquito which carries the malaria parasite 
anoplasty  ||  noun surgery to repair the anus , as in treating haemorrhoids 
anorchism  ||  noun a congenital absence of testicles 
anorectal  ||  adjective referring to both the anus and rectum 
anorectic  ||  noun a medicine that suppresses the appetite adjective relating to life - threatening loss of appetite 
anorexia  ||  noun loss of appetite 
anorexia nervosa  ||  noun a psychological condition , usually found in girls and young women , in which a person refuses to eat because of a fear of becoming fat 
anorexic  ||  adjective 1 .  referring to anorexia 2 .  having anorexia the school has developed a programme of counselling for anorexic students .  
anosmia  ||  noun the lack of the sense of smell 
anovulant  ||  noun a drug that prevents ovulation , e.g.  a birth - control pill 
anovular  ||  adjective without an ovum 
anovular bleeding  ||  noun bleeding from the uterus when ovulation has not taken place 
anovulation  ||  noun a condition in which a women does not ovulate and is therefore infertile 
anoxaemia  ||  noun a reduction of the amount of oxygen in the blood 
anoxia  ||  noun a lack of oxygen in body tissue 
anoxic  ||  adjective referring to anoxia or lacking oxygen 
anserina  ||  cutis anserina 
antacid  ||  adjective preventing too much acid forming in the stomach or altering the amount of acid in the stomach  noun a substance that stops too much acid forming in the stomach , used in the treatment of gastrointestinal conditions such as ulcers , e.g.  calcium carbonate or magnesium trisilicate 
antagonism  ||  noun 1 .  the opposing force that usually exists between pairs of muscles 2 .  the interaction between two or more chemical substances in the body that reduces the effect that each substance has individually 
antagonist  ||  adjective 1 .  referring to a muscle which opposes another muscle in a movement 2 .  referring to a substance which opposes another substance  noun a substance which acts through specific receptors to block the action of another substance , but which has no observable physiological effect itself  atropine is a cholinergic antagonist and blocks the effects of acetylcholine .  
ante -  ||  prefix before 
ante cibum  ||  adverb full form of a . c .  
anteflexion  ||  noun the curving forward of an organ , e.g.  the usual curvature of the uterus 
antegrade amnesia  ||  noun a form of memory loss relating to the things that happen after a traumatic event 
antemortem  ||  noun the period before death 
antenatal  ||  adjective during the period between conception and childbirth 
antenatal clinic  ||  noun a clinic where expectant mothers are taught how to look after babies , do exercises and have medical checkups .  also called maternity clinic 
antenatal diagnosis  ||  noun a medical examination of a pregnant woman to see if the fetus is developing in the usual way .  also called prenatal diagnosis 
antepartum  ||  noun the period of three months before childbirth adjective referring to the three months before childbirth 
antepartum haemorrhage  ||  noun bleeding from the vagina before labour .  abbr aph 
anterior  ||  adjective in front .  opposite posterior 
anterior aspect  ||  noun a view of the front of the body , or of the front of part of the body .  see illustration at anatomical terms in supplement 
anterior chamber  ||  noun part of the aqueous chamber of the eye which is in front of the iris 
anterior fontanelle  ||  noun the cartilage at the top of the head where the frontal bone joins the two parietals 
anterior jugular  ||  noun a small jugular vein in the neck 
anterior nares  ||  plural noun the two nostrils .  also called external nares 
anterior superior iliac spine  ||  noun a projection at the front end of the iliac crest of the pelvis 
anterior synechia  ||  noun a condition of the eye , where the iris sticks to the cornea 
anterograde amnesia  ||  noun a brain condition in which the person cannot remember things which happened recently 
anteversion  ||  noun the tilting forward of an organ , whether usual , as of the uterus , or unusual 
anthelmintic  ||  noun a substance which removes worms from the intestine • adjective removing worms from the intestine 
anthracosis  ||  noun a lung disease caused by breathing coal dust 
anthrax  ||  noun a disease of cattle and sheep which can be transmitted to humans comment :  caused by bacillus anthracis , anthrax can be transmitted by touching infected skin , meat or other parts of an animal , including bone meal used as a fertiliser .  it causes pustules on the skin or in the lungs , ‘woolsorters disease’ .  
anthrop -  ||  prefix referring to human beings 
anthropometry  ||  noun the study of human body measurements ( note :  the uses of anthropometry include the design of ergonomic furniture and the examination and comparison of populations .  ) 
anti -  ||  prefix against antiallergenic  ||  adjective referring to something such as a cosmetic which will not aggravate an allergy 
antiarrhythmic  ||  adjective referring to a drug which corrects an irregular heartbeat 
antiasthmatic  ||  adjective referring to a drug that is used to treat asthma 
antibacterial  ||  adjective destroying bacteria 
antibiogram  ||  noun a laboratory technique which establishes to what degree an organism is sensitive to an antibiotic 
antibiotic  ||  adjective stopping the spread of bacteria noun a drug which is developed from living substances and which stops the spread of bacteria , e.g.  penicillin o he was given a course of antibiotics .  o antibiotics have no effect against viral diseases .  comment :  penicillin is one of the commonest antibiotics , together with streptomycin , tetracycline , erythromycin and many others .  although antibiotics are widely and successfully used , new forms of bacteria have developed which are resistant to them .  
antibody  ||  noun a protein that is stimulated by the body to produce foreign substances such as bacteria , as part of an immune reaction o tests showed that he had antibodies in his blood .  
antibody - negative  ||  adjective showing none of a particular antibody in the blood o the donor tested antibody - negative .  
antibody - positive  ||  adjective showing the presence of particular antibodies in the blood o the patient is hiv antibody - positive .  
anti - cancer drug  ||  noun a drug which can control or destroy cancer cells 
anticholinergic  ||  adjective blocking nerve impulses which are part of the stress response noun one of a group of drugs which are used to control stress 
anticholinesterase  ||  noun a substance which blocks nerve impulses by reducing the activity of the enzyme cholinesterase 
anticoagulant  ||  adjective slowing or stopping the clotting of blood noun a drug which slows down or stops the clotting of blood , used to prevent the formation of a thrombus ( note :  anticoagulants have names ending in  - parin :  heparin .  ) 
anticonvulsant  ||  adjective acting to control convulsions • noun a drug used to control convulsions , as in the treatment of epilepsy , e.g.  carbamazepine 
anti - d  ||  , anti - d gamma - globulin  ||  noun rh d immunoglobulin , used to treat pregnant women who develop antibodies when the mother is rh - negative and the fetus is rh - positive 
antidepressant  ||  adjective acting to relieve depression noun a drug used to relieve depression by stimulating the mood of a depressed person .  examples are tricyclic antidepressants , selective serotonin re - uptake inhibitors and monoamine oxidase inhibitors .  
antidiabetic  ||  noun a drug used in the treatment of diabetes  adjective referring to an antidiabetic drug 
antidiarrhoeal  ||  noun a drug used in the treatment of diarrhoea  adjective referring to an antidiarrhoeal drug ( note :  [all senses] the us spelling is antidiarrheal .  ) 
anti - d immunoglobulin  ||  noun immunoglobulin administered to rh - negative mothers after the birth of an rh - positive baby , to prevent haemolytic disease of the newborn in the next pregnancy 
antidiuretic  ||  noun a substance which stops the production of excessive amounts of urine  hormones which have an antidiuretic effect on the kidneys adjective preventing the excessive production of urine 
antidiuretic hormone  ||  noun a hormone secreted by the posterior lobe of the pituitary gland which acts on the kidneys to regulate the quantity of salt in body fluids and the amount of urine excreted by the kidneys .  also called vasopressin 
antidote  ||  noun a substance which counteracts the effect of a poison  there is no satisfactory antidote to cyanide .  
antiembolic  ||  adjective preventing embolism 
antiemetic  ||  noun a drug which prevents vomiting adjective acting to prevent vomiting 
antiepileptic drug  ||  noun a drug used in the treatment of epilepsy and convulsions , e.g.  carbamazepine 
antifibrinolytic  ||  adjective acting to reduce fibrosis 
antifungal  ||  adjective referring to a substance which kills or controls fungal and yeast infections , e.g.  candida and ringworm ( note :  antifungal drugs have names ending in  - conazole :  fluconazole .  ) 
antigen  ||  noun a substance that stimulates the body to produce antibodies , e.g.  a protein on the surface of a cell or microorganism 
antigenic  ||  adjective referring to a substance which stimulates the formation of antibodies 
antihaemophilic factor  ||  noun factor viii , used to encourage blood - clotting in haemophiliacs .  abbr ahf 
antihelminthic  ||  noun a drug used in the treatment of worm infections such as threadworm , hookworm or roundworm 
antihistamine  ||  noun a drug used to control the effects of an allergy which releases histamine , or reduces gastric acid in the stomach for the treatment of gastric ulcers ( note :  antihistamines have names ending in  - tidine :  loratidine for allergies , cimetidine for gastric ulcers .  ) 
anti - hiv antibody  ||  noun an antibody which attacks hiv 
antihypertensive  ||  adjective acting to reduce blood pressure  noun a drug used to reduce high blood pressure 
anti - inflammatory  ||  adjective referring to a drug which reduces inflammation 
antilymphocytic serum  ||  noun a serum used to produce immunosuppression in people undergoing transplant operations .  abbr als 
antimalarial  ||  noun a drug used to treat malaria and in malarial prophylaxis  adjective treating or preventing malaria 
antimetabolite  ||  noun a substance which can replace a cell metabolism , but which is not active 
antimicrobial  ||  adjective acting against microorganisms that cause disease 
antimigraine  ||  noun a drug used in the treatment of migraine 
antimitotic  ||  adjective preventing the division of a cell by mitosis 
antimuscarinic  ||  adjective referring to a drug which blocks acetylcholine receptors found on smooth muscle in the gut and eye 
antimycotic  ||  adjective destroying fungi 
antinauseant  ||  adjective referring to a drug which helps to suppress nausea 
antioxidant  ||  noun a substance which makes oxygen less damaging , e.g. in the body or in foods or plastics  antioxidant vitamins 
antiperistalsis  ||  noun a movement in the oesophagus or intestine which causes their contents to move in the opposite direction to usual peristalsis , so leading to vomiting 
antiperspirant  ||  noun a substance which prevents sweating  adjective preventing sweating 
antipruritic  ||  noun a substance which prevents itching  adjective preventing itching 
antipsychotic  ||  noun a neuroleptic or major tranquilliser drug which calms disturbed people without causing sedation or confusion by blocking dopamine receptors in the brain comment :  extrapyramidal side - effects can occur from the use of antipsychotics , including parkinsonian symptoms and restlessness .  
antipyretic  ||  noun a drug which helps to reduce a fever  adjective reducing fever 
anti - rh body  ||  noun an antibody formed in a mothers blood in reaction to a rhesus antigen in the blood of the fetus 
antisepsis  ||  noun a procedure intended to prevent sepsis 
antiseptic  ||  adjective preventing harmful microorganisms from spreading  she gargled with an antiseptic mouthwash .  noun a substance which prevents germs growing or spreading the nurse painted the wound with antiseptic .  
antiserum  ||  noun serum ( note :  the plural is antisera .  ) 
antisocial  ||  adjective referring to behaviour which is harmful to other people 
antispasmodic  ||  noun a drug used to prevent spasms 
antitetanus serum  ||  noun a serum which protects a patient against tetanus .  abbr ats 
antithrombin  ||  noun a substance present in the blood which prevents clotting 
antitoxic serum  ||  noun an immunising agent , formed of serum taken from an animal which has developed antibodies to a disease , used to protect a person from that disease 
antitoxin  ||  noun an antibody produced by the body to counteract a poison in the body 
antitragus  ||  noun a small projection on the outer ear opposite the tragus 
antituberculous drug  ||  noun a drug used to treat tuberculosis , e.g. isoniazid or rifampicin 
antitussive  ||  noun a drug used to reduce coughing 
antivenin  ||  , antivenom  ||  , antivenene  ||  noun a substance which helps the body to fight the effects of a particular venom from a snake or insect bite 
antiviral  ||  adjective referring to a drug or treatment which stops or reduces the damage caused by a virus noun same as antiviral drug 
antiviral drug  ||  noun a drug which is effective against a virus ( note :  antiviral drugs have names ending in  - ciclovir .  ) 
antra  ||  plural of antrum 
antral  ||  adjective referring to an antrum 
antral puncture  ||  noun making a hole in the wall of the maxillary sinus to remove fluid 
antrectomy  ||  noun the surgical removal of an antrum in the stomach to prevent gastrin being formed 
antroscopy  ||  noun an examination of an antrum 
antrostomy  ||  noun a surgical operation to make an opening in the maxillary sinus to drain an antrum 
antrum  ||  noun any cavity inside the body , especially one in bone ( note :  the plural is antra .  ) 
anuria  ||  noun a condition in which the patient does not make urine , either because of a deficiency in the kidneys or because the urinary tract is blocked 
anus  ||  noun a short passage after the rectum at the end of the alimentary canal , leading outside the body between the buttocks and through which faeces are passed .  see illustration at digestive system in supplement , urogenital system ( male ) in supplement ( note :  for other terms referring to the anus , see anal and words beginning with ano -  .  ) 
anvil  ||  noun same as incus 
anxiety  ||  noun the state of being very worried and afraid 
anxiety disorder  ||  noun a mental disorder where someone is very worried and afraid , e.g.  a phobia 
anxiety neurosis  ||  noun a neurotic condition where the patient is anxious and has morbid fears 
anxiolytic  ||  noun a drug used in the treatment of anxiety adjective treating anxiety 
anxious  ||  adjective 1 .  very worried and afraid my sister is ill – i am anxious about her .  2 .  eager she was anxious to get home .  i was anxious to see the doctor .  
aorta  ||  noun the main artery in the body , which sends blood containing oxygen from the heart to other blood vessels around the body .  see illustration at heart in supplement comment :  the aorta is about 45 centimetres long .  it leaves the left ventricle , rises where the carotid arteries branch off , then goes downwards through the abdomen and divides into the two iliac arteries .  the aorta is the blood vessel which carries all arterial blood from the heart .  
aortic  ||  adjective relating to the aorta 
aortic aneurysm  ||  noun a serious aneurysm of the aorta , associated with atherosclerosis 
aortic arch  ||  noun a bend in the aorta which links the ascending aorta to the descending aorta 
aortic hiatus  ||  noun an opening in the diaphragm through which the aorta passes 
aortic incompetence  ||  noun a condition in which the aortic valve does not close properly , causing regurgitation 
aortic regurgitation  ||  noun a backward flow of blood caused by a malfunctioning aortic valve 
aortic sinuses  ||  plural noun swellings in the aorta from which the coronary arteries lead back into the heart itself 
aortic stenosis  ||  noun a condition in which the aortic valve is narrow , caused by rheumatic fever 
aortic valve  ||  noun a valve with three flaps , situated at the opening into the aorta 
aortitis  ||  noun inflammation of the aorta 
aortography  ||  noun an x - ray examination of the aorta after an opaque substance has been injected into it a . p .  adverb before a meal .  full form ante prandium 
apathetic  ||  adjective referring to a person who takes no interest in anything 
apathy  ||  noun the condition of not being interested in anything , or of not wanting to do anything 
aperient  ||  noun a substance which causes a bowel movement , e.g.  a laxative or purgative adjective causing a bowel movement 
aperistalsis  ||  noun a lack of the peristaltic movement in the bowel 
aperts syndrome  ||  noun a condition in which the skull grows tall and the lower part of the face is underdeveloped 
aperture  ||  noun a hole 
apex  ||  noun 1 .  the top of the heart or lung 2 .  the end of the root of a tooth 
apex beat  ||  noun a heartbeat which can be felt if the hand is placed on the heart 
apgar score  ||  noun a method of judging the condition of a newborn baby in which the baby is given a maximum of two points on each of five criteria :  colour of the skin , heartbeat , breathing , muscle tone and reaction to stimuli [described 1952 .  after virginia apgar ( 1909–74 ) , us anaesthesiologist . ] ‘…in this study , babies having an apgar score of four or less had 100% mortality .  the lower the apgar score , the poorer the chance of survival’ [indian journal of medical sciences] 
aph abbr antepartum haemorrhage 
aphagia  ||  noun a condition in which a person is unable to swallow 
aphakia  ||  noun the absence of the crystalline lens in the eye 
aphakic  ||  adjective referring to aphakia 
aphasia  ||  noun a condition in which a person is unable to speak or write , or to understand speech or writing because of damage to the brain centres controlling speech 
apheresis  ||  noun the transfusion of blood , from which some components have been removed , back into a patient 
aphonia  ||  noun a condition in which a person is unable to make sounds 
aphrodisiac  ||  noun a substance which increases sexual urges • adjective increasing sexual desire 
aphtha  ||  noun a small white ulcer which appears in groups in the mouth in people who have the fungal condition thrush ( note :  the plural is apthae .  ) 
aphthous stomatitis  ||  noun canker sores which affect the mucous membrane in the mouth 
aphthous ulcer  ||  noun same as mouth ulcer 
apical  ||  adjective situated at the top or tip of something 
apical abscess  ||  noun an abscess in the socket around the root of a tooth 
apicectomy  ||  noun the surgical removal of the root of a tooth 
aplasia  ||  noun a lack of growth of tissue 
aplastic  ||  adjective unable to develop new cells or tissue 
aplastic anaemia  ||  noun anaemia caused by the bone marrow failing to form red blood cells 
apnea  ||  noun us same as apnoea 
apneusis  ||  noun a breathing pattern caused by brain damage , in which each breath is held for a long time 
apnoea  ||  noun the stopping of breathing ( note :  the us spelling is apnea .  ) 
apnoeic  ||  adjective where breathing has stopped ( note :  the us spelling is apneic .  ) 
apocrine  ||  adjective referring to apocrine glands 
apocrine gland  ||  noun a gland producing body odour where parts of the glands cells break off with the secretions , e.g.  a sweat gland 
apocrinitis  ||  noun the formation of abscesses in the sweat glands 
apolipoprotein e  ||  noun a compound found in three varieties which transport lipids within the cell and across cell membranes , the genes for two of which are linked with increased risk of alzheimers disease .  abbr apoe 
apomorphine  ||  noun a substance that comes from morphine , used to make a person cough , sleep or be sick ( note :  it is administered under the skin and is used to treat drug overdose , accidental poisoning and parkinsons disease .  ) 
aponeurosis  ||  noun a band of tissue which attaches muscles to each other 
apophyseal  ||  adjective referring to apophysis 
apophysis  ||  noun a growth of bone , not at a joint 
apophysitis  ||  noun inflammation of an apophysis 
apoplexy  ||  noun same as cerebrovascular accident ( dated ) 
apoptosis  ||  noun a form of cell death that is necessary both to make room for new cells and to remove cells whose dna has been damaged and which may become cancerous app abbr amyloid precursor protein 
apparatus  ||  noun equipment used in a laboratory or hospital the hospital has installed new apparatus in the physiotherapy department .  the blood sample was tested in a special piece of apparatus .  ( note :  no plural :  use a piece of apparatus ; some new apparatus .  ) 
appendage  ||  noun a part of the body or piece of tissue which hangs down from another part 
appendectomy  ||  noun us same as appendicectomy 
appendiceal  ||  adjective relating to the appendix  there is a risk of appendiceal infection .  
appendiceal colic  ||  noun colic caused by an inflamed appendix 
appendicectomy  ||  noun the surgical removal of an appendix 
appendicitis  ||  noun inflammation of the vermiform appendix comment :  appendicitis takes several forms .  in acute appendicitis there is a sudden attack of severe pain in the right lower part of the abdomen , accompanied by a fever .  acute appendicitis usually requires urgent surgery .  in chronic appendicitis , the appendix is slightly inflamed , giving a dull pain or a feeling of indigestion over a period of time ( a ‘grumbling appendix’ ) .  
appendicular  ||  adjective 1 .  referring to body parts which are associated with the arms and legs 2 .  relating to the appendix 
appendicular skeleton  ||  noun part of the skeleton , formed of the pelvic girdle , pectoral girdle and the bones of the arms and legs .  compare axial skeleton 
appendix  ||  noun 1 .  a small tube attached to the caecum which serves no function but can become infected , causing appendicitis .  also called vermiform appendix .  see illustration at digestive system in supplement 2 .  any small tube or sac hanging from an organ 
apperception  ||  noun the conscious recognition of a stimulus 
appetite  ||  noun the feeling of wanting food good appetite interest in eating food loss of appetite becoming uninterested in eating food 
applanation tonometry  ||  noun the measuring of the thickness of the cornea 
appliance  ||  noun a piece of apparatus used on the body he was wearing a surgical appliance to support his neck .  
application  ||  noun 1 .  the process of putting a medication or bandage on a body part two applications of the lotion should be made each day .  2 .  the process of asking officially for something , usually in writing if you are applying for the job , you must fill in an application form .  
applicator  ||  noun an instrument for applying a substance 
appointment  ||  noun an arrangement to see someone at a particular time i have an appointment with the doctor or to see the doctor on tuesday .  
apposition  ||  noun 1 .  the relative positioning of two things 2 .  cell growth in which layers of new material are deposited on existing ones 
appraisal  ||  noun a judgment or opinion on something or somebody , especially one which decides how effective or useful they are 
apprehension  ||  noun a feeling of anxiety or fear that something bad or unpleasant will happen 
approach  ||  noun 1 .  a way of dealing with a problem the authority has adopted a radical approach to the problem of patient waiting lists .  2 .  a method used by a surgeon when carrying out an operation 
approve  ||  verb to approve of something to think that something is good i don’t approve of patients staying in bed .  the medical council does not approve of this new treatment .  
apraxia  ||  noun a condition in which someone is unable to make proper movements 
apyrexia  ||  noun the absence of fever

arbor vitae  ||  noun the structure of the cerebellum or of the uterus which looks like a tree 
arbovirus  ||  noun a virus transmitted by blood - sucking insects

arginine  ||  noun an amino acid which helps the liver form urea 
argon laser  ||  noun a laser used in sealing blood vessels and destroying specific lesions 
argyll robertson pupil  ||  noun a condition of the eye , in which the lens is able to focus but the pupil does not react to light .  it is a symptom of tertiary syphilis or of locomotor ataxia .  
ariboflavinosis  ||  noun a condition caused by not having enough vitamin b2 .  the symptoms are very oily skin and hair and small cuts in the mouth .  
arm  ||  noun the part of the body from the shoulder to the hand , formed of the upper arm , the elbow and the forearm  she broke her arm skiing .   lift your arms up above your head .  ( note :  for other terms referring to the arm see words beginning with brachi -  , brachio -  .  ) 
arm bones  ||  plural noun the humerus , the ulna and the radius 
armpit  ||  noun the hollow under the shoulder , between the upper arm and the body , where the upper arm joins the shoulder , containing several important blood vessels , lymph nodes and sweat glands .  also called axilla 
arm sling  ||  noun a support for an injured arm that prevents it from moving by tying it against the chest 
arnold - chiari malformation  ||  noun a congenital condition in which the base of the skull is malformed , allowing parts of the cerebellum into the spinal canal [described 1894 .  after julius a .  arnold ( 1835–1915 ) , professor of pathological anatomy at heidelberg , germany , and hans von chiari ( 1851–1916 ) , professor of pathological anatomy at strasbourg and later at prague , czech republic . ] 
aromatherapist  ||  noun a person specialising in aromatherapy 
aromatherapy  ||  noun treatment to relieve tension and promote wellbeing in which fragrant oils and creams containing plant extracts are massaged into the skin 
arousal  ||  noun 1 .  feelings and physical signs of sexual desire 2 .  the act of waking up from sleep , unconsciousness or a drowsy state 
arrector pili  ||  noun a small muscle which contracts and makes the hair on the skin stand up when someone is cold or afraid 
arrest  ||  noun the stopping of a bodily function .  cardiac arrest 
arrhythmia  ||  noun a variation in the rhythm of the heartbeat ‘cardiovascular effects may include atrial arrhythmias but at 30°c there is the possibility of spontane ous ventricular fibrillation’ [british journal of nursing] 
arrhythmic  ||  adjective ( of a heartbeat or breathing ) rhythmically irregular .  antiarrhythmic

arteritis  ||  noun inflammation of the walls of an artery 
artery  ||  noun a blood vessel taking blood from the heart to the tissues of the body comment :  in most arteries the blood has been oxygenated in the lungs and is bright red in colour .  in the pulmonary artery , the blood is deoxygenated and so is darker .  the arterial system begins with the aorta which leaves the heart and from which all the arteries branch .

asbestosis  ||  noun a disease of the lungs caused by inhaling asbestos dust comment :  asbestos was formerly widely used in cement and cladding and other types of fireproof construction materials .  it is now recognised that asbestos dust can cause many lung diseases , leading in some cases to forms of cancer .  
ascariasis  ||  noun a disease of the intestine and sometimes the lungs , caused by infestation with ascaris lumbricoides 
ascaris lumbricoides  ||  noun a type of large roundworm which is a parasite in the human intestine 
ascending  ||  adjective going upwards 
ascending aorta  ||  noun the first section of the aorta as it leaves the heart and turns upwards .  compare descending aorta 
ascending colon  ||  noun the first part of the colon which goes up the right side of the body from the caecum .  compare descending colon .  see illustration at digestive system in supplement 
aschoff nodules  ||  , aschoffs nodules  ||  plural noun nodules which are formed mainly in or near the heart in rheumatic fever 
ascites  ||  noun an unusual accumulation of fluid from the blood in the peritoneal cavity , occurring in heart and kidney failure or as a result of malignancy 
ascorbic acid  ||  noun same as vitamin c comment :  ascorbic acid is found in fresh fruit , especially oranges and lemons and in vegetables .  lack of vitamin c can cause anaemia and scurvy .

atherogenic  ||  adjective referring to something which may produce 
atheroma atheroma  ||  noun thickening of the walls of an artery by deposits of a fatty substance such as cholesterol 
atheromatous  ||  adjective referring to atheroma 
atherosclerosis  ||  noun a condition in which deposits of fats and minerals form on the walls of an artery , especially the aorta or one of the coronary or cerebral arteries , and prevent blood from flowing easily 
atherosclerotic  ||  adjective referring to atherosclerosis 
atherosclerotic plaque  ||  noun a deposit on the walls of arteries 
athetosis  ||  noun repeated slow movements of the limbs , caused by a brain disorder such as cerebral palsy 
athletes foot  ||  noun an infectious skin disorder between the toes , caused by a fungus .  also called tinea pedis 
atlas  ||  noun the top vertebra in the spine , which supports the skull and pivots on the axis or second vertebra 
atmospheric pressure  ||  noun the pressure of the air on the surface of the earth comment :  disorders due to variations in atmospheric pressure include mountain sickness and caisson diseases .  
atomic cocktail  ||  noun a radioactive substance in liquid form , used to diagnose or treat cancer ( informal ) 
atomiser  ||  noun an instrument which sprays liquid in the form of very small drops like mist .  also called nebuliser 
atonic  ||  adjective referring to lack of muscle tone or tension 
atony  ||  noun a lack of tone or tension in the muscles 
atopen  ||  noun an allergen which causes an atopy 
atopic  ||  adjective referring to conditions arising from an inherited tendency to react to specific allergens , as in hay fever , some skin conditions and asthma 
atopic eczema  ||  , atopic dermatitis  ||  noun a type of eczema often caused by a hereditary allergy 
atopy  ||  noun a hereditary allergic reaction 
atp abbr adenosine triphosphate 
atracurium  ||  noun a drug used as a relaxant 
atresia  ||  noun an unusual closing or absence of a tube in the body 
atretic  ||  adjective referring to atresia 
atretic follicle  ||  noun the scarred remains of an ovarian follicle 
atri -  ||  prefix referring to an atrium 
atria  ||  plural of atrium 
atrial  ||  adjective referring to one or both of the atria of the heart 
atrial fibrillation  ||  noun a rapid uncoordinated fluttering of the atria of the heart , which causes an irregular heartbeat 
atrial septal defect  ||  noun a congenital condition in which a hole in the wall between the two atria of the heart allows blood to flow through the heart and lungs .  compare ventricular septal defect 
atrioventricular  ||  adjective referring to the atria and ventricles 
atrioventricular bundle  ||  noun a bundle of modified cardiac muscle which conducts impulses from the atrioventricular node to the septum and then divides to connect with the ventricles .  also called av bundle , bundle of his 
atrioventricular groove  ||  noun a groove round the outside of the heart , showing the division between the atria and ventricles 
atrioventricular node  ||  noun a mass of conducting tissue in the right atrium of the heart , which continues as the atrioventricular bundle and passes impulses from the atria to the ventricles .  also called av node 
at - risk  ||  adjective exposed to danger or harm of some kind at - risk children 
atrium  ||  noun 1 .  one of the two upper chambers in the heart .  see illustration at heart in supplement 2 .  a cavity in the ear behind the eardrum ( note :  the plural is atria .  ) comment :  the two atria in the heart both receive blood from veins .  the right atrium receives venous blood from the superior and inferior venae cavae and the left atrium receives oxygenated blood from the pulmonary veins .  
atrophic cirrhosis  ||  noun advanced portal cirrhosis in which the liver has become considerably smaller and clumps of new cells are formed on the surface of the liver where fibrous tissue has replaced damaged liver cells .  also called hobnail liver 
atrophic gastritis  ||  noun inflammation of the stomach caused by being unable to produce enough acid to kill bacteria 
atrophic vaginitis  ||  noun inflammation , thinning and shrinking of the tissues of the vagina caused by a lack of 
oestrogen atrophy  ||  noun the wasting of an organ or part of the body verb ( of an organ or part of the body ) to waste away 
atropine  ||  noun an alkaloid substance derived from the poisonous plant belladonna and used , among other things , to enlarge the pupil of the eye , to reduce salivary and bronchial secretions during anaesthesia and as a muscarinic antagonist 
ats  ||  abbr antitetanus serum 
attack  ||  noun a sudden occurrence of an illness  he had an attack of fever .   she had two attacks of laryngitis during the winter .  
attempted suicide  ||  noun an unsuccessful attempt to kill oneself 
attending physician  ||  noun a doctor who is looking after a particular patient  he was referred to the hypertension unit by his attending physician .  
attention deficit disorder  ||  noun a condition in which a person is unable to concentrate , does things without considering their actions properly and has little confidence .  it occurs mainly in children .  abbr add 
attention deficit hyperactivity disorder  ||  noun a condition in which a child has an inability to concentrate and shows disruptive behaviour .  abbr adhd 
attention deficit syndrome  ||  noun same as attention deficit disorder 
attenuation  ||  noun a reduction in the effect or strength of something such as a virus , either because of environmental conditions or as a result of a laboratory procedure 
atticotomy  ||  noun the removal of the wall in the inner ear .  also called cortical mastoidectomy 
attitude  ||  noun 1 .  an opinion or general feeling about something a positive attitude towards the operation 2 .  a way of standing or sitting 
attributable risk  ||  noun a measure of the excess risk of disease due to exposure to a particular risk .  the excess risk of bacteriuria in oral contraceptive users attributable to the use of oral contraceptives is 1 ,566 per 100 ,000 .  abbr ar 
attrition  ||  noun the condition of being worn away , as may be caused by friction examination showed attrition of two extensor tendons .  
atypical  ||  adjective not usual or expected  an atypical renal cyst 
audi -  ||  prefix same as audio - ( used before vowels ) 
audible limits  ||  plural noun upper and lower limits of the sound frequencies which can be heard by humans 
audio -  ||  prefix referring to hearing or sound 
audiogram  ||  noun a graph drawn by an audiometer 
audiologist  ||  noun a specialist who deals in the treatment of hearing disorders 
audiology  ||  noun the scientific study of hearing , especially for diagnosing and treating hearing loss 
audiometer  ||  noun an apparatus for testing hearing , especially for testing the range of sounds that the human ear can detect 
audiometry  ||  noun the science of testing hearing 
audit  ||  noun a check on figures , scientific data or procedures a medical audit regarding the outpatient appointment system 
audit cycle  ||  noun the cycle in which medical topics are selected for review , observation and comparison with agreed standards and changes are decided on 
auditory  ||  adjective relating to hearing 
auditory acuity  ||  noun the ability to hear sounds clearly 
auditory canals  ||  plural noun the external and internal passages of the ear 
auditory nerve  ||  noun the eighth cranial nerve which governs hearing and balance .  see illustration at ear in supplement .  also called vestibulocochlear nerve 
auditory ossicles  ||  plural noun the three little bones , the malleus , incus and stapes , in the middle ear 
auerbachs plexus  ||  noun a group of nerve fibres in the intestine wall [described 1862 .  after leopold auerbach ( 1828–97 ) , professor of neuropathology at breslau , now in poland . ] 
aura  ||  noun a warning sensation which is experienced before an attack of epilepsy , migraine or asthma 
aural  ||  adjective referring to the ear 
aural polyp  ||  noun a polyp in the middle ear 
aural surgery  ||  noun surgery on the ear 
auricle  ||  noun the tip of each atrium in the heart 
auriculae  ||  concha auriculae 
auricular  ||  adjective 1 .  referring to the ear 2 .  referring to an auricle 
auricular vein  ||  noun a vein which leads into the posterior facial vein 
auriscope  ||  noun an instrument for examining the ear and eardrum .  also called otoscope 
auscultation  ||  noun the act of listening to the sounds of the body using a stethoscope 
auscultatory  ||  adjective referring to auscultation 
australia antigen  ||  noun an antigen produced on the surface of liver cells infected with the hepatitis b virus 
autism  ||  noun a condition developing in childhood , characterised by difficulty in social interaction , language and communication problems , learning difficulties and obsessional repetitive behaviour ( note :  autism is more common in boys than in girls .  ) 
autistic  ||  adjective affected by , or relating to , autism 
autistic spectrum disorders  ||  plural noun autism in all its different forms and degrees of severity .  abbr asd 
auto -  ||  prefix self auto
antibody  ||  noun an antibody formed to attack antigens in the bodys own cells 
autoclavable  ||  adjective able to be sterilised in an autoclave waste should be put into autoclavable plastic bags .  
autoclave  ||  noun equipment for sterilising surgical instruments using heat under high pressure verb to sterilise equipment using heat under high pressure  autoclaving is the best method of sterilisation .  
autogenous  ||  , autogenic  ||  adjective produced either in the persons body , or using tissue from the persons own body  an autogenous vein graft 
autograft  ||  noun a transplant made using parts of the persons own body 
autoimmune  ||  adjective referring to an immune reaction in a person against antigens in their own cells 
autoimmune disease  ||  noun a disease in which the persons own cells are attacked by autoantibodies  rheumatoid arthritis is thought to be an autoimmune disease .  
autoimmunisation  ||  ,autoimmunization noun the process leading to an immune reaction in a person to antigens produced in their own body 
autoimmunity  ||  noun a condition in which a persons own cells are attacked by autoantibodies 
autoinfection  ||  noun an infection by a microorganism already in the body , or infection of one part of the body by another part 
autointoxication  ||  noun the poisoning of the body by toxins produced in the body itself 
autologous  ||  adjective referring to a graft or other material coming from the same source 
autologous transfusion  ||  noun a blood transfusion in which the blood is removed from the body for later transfusion after an operation .  transfusion 
autolysis  ||  noun a situation in which cells destroy themselves with their own enzymes 
automatic  ||  adjective 1 .  done without conscious thoughtan automatic reaction 2 .  ( of a machine or process ) able to work by itself , without anyone giving instructions 
automatism  ||  noun a state in which a person acts without consciously knowing that he or she is acting comment :  automatic acts can take place after concussion or epileptic fits .  in law , automatism can be a defence to a criminal charge when the accused states that he or she acted without knowing what they were doing .  
autonomic  ||  adjective governing itself independently 
autonomic nervous system  ||  noun the nervous system formed of ganglia linked to the spinal column .  it regulates the automatic functioning of the main organs such as the heart and lungs and works when a person is asleep or even unconscious .  parasympathetic nervous system , sympathetic nervous system 
autonomy  ||  noun the state of being free to act as one wishes 
autoplasty  ||  noun the repair of someones body using tissue taken from another part of their body 
autopsy  ||  noun the examination of a dead body by a pathologist to find out the cause of death  the autopsy showed that he had been poisoned .  also called post mortem 
autosomal  ||  adjective referring to an autosome 
autosome  ||  noun a chromosome that is not a sex chromosome 
autotransfusion  ||  noun an infusion into a person of their own blood 
auxiliary  ||  adjective providing help  the hospital has an auxiliary power supply in case the electricity supply breaks down .   noun an assistant 
avascular  ||  adjective with no blood vessels , or with a deficient blood supply 
avascular necrosis  ||  noun a condition in which tissue cells die because their supply of blood has been cut 
av bundle  ||  noun same as atrioventricular bundle 
average  ||  noun 1 .  the usual amount , size , rate , etc .   her weight is above ( the ) average .  2 .  a value calculated by adding together several quantities and then dividing the total by the number of quantities  adjective 1 .  usual  their son is of above average weight .  2 .  calculated by adding together several quantities and then dividing the total by the number of quantities  the average age of the group is 25 .  
aversion therapy  ||  noun a treatment by which someone is cured of a type of behaviour by making him or her develop a great dislike for it 
avitaminosis  ||  noun a disorder caused by a lack of vitamins avm abbr arteriovenous malformation 
av node  ||  noun same as atrioventricular node avpu noun a method of rating if a person is conscious :  a = alert ; v = verbal , responding to verbal commands ; p = pain , responding to pain ; u = unconscious 
avulse  ||  verb to tear tissue or a body part away by force 
avulsion  ||  noun an act of pulling away tissue or a body part by force 
avulsion fracture  ||  noun a fracture in which a tendon pulls away part of the bone to which it is attached 
awake  ||  adjective not asleep  he was still awake at 2 o’clock in the morning .  wide awake very awake 
aware  ||  adjective 1 .  conscious enough to know what is happening  she is not aware of what is happening around her .  2 .  knowing about something  the surgeon became aware of a problem with the heart - lung machine .  
awareness  ||  noun the fact of being aware , especially of a problem ‘…doctors should use the increased public awareness of whooping cough during epidemics to encourage parents to vaccinate children’ [health visitor] 
axial  ||  adjective referring to an axis 
axial skeleton  ||  noun the bones that make up the vertebral column and the skull .  compare appendicular skeleton 
axilla  ||  noun same as armpit ( technical ) ( note :  the plural is axillae .  ) 
axillary  ||  adjective referring to the armpit 
axillary artery  ||  noun an artery leading from the subclavian artery in the armpit 
axillary nodes  ||  plural noun part of the lymphatic system in the arm 
axillary temperature  ||  noun the temperature in the armpit 
axis  ||  noun 1 .  an imaginary line through the centre of the body 2 .  a central vessel which divides into other vessels 3 .  the second vertebra on which the atlas sits ( note :  the plural is axes .  ) 
axodendrite  ||  noun an appendage like a fibril on the axon of a nerve 
axolemma  ||  noun a membrane covering an axon 
axon  ||  noun a nerve fibre which sends impulses from one neurone to another , linking with the dendrites of the other neurone .  see illustration at neurone in supplement 
axon covering  ||  noun the myelin sheath which covers a nerve 
ayurvedic medicine  ||  noun a traditional hindu system of healing that reviews a persons state of health and lifestyle and recommends treatment based on herbal products , dietary control and spiritual practices

babesiosis  ||  noun a disease caused by infection of red blood cells by a protozoan introduced by a tick bite 
babinski reflex  ||  , babinskis reflex  ||  noun an unusual curling upwards of the big toe when a finger is lightly run across the sole of the foot , while the others turn down and spread out , a sign of hemiplegia and pyramidal tract disease .  compare plantar reflex [described 1896 .  after joseph françois felix babinski ( 1857– 1932 ) , french - born son of polish refugees .  a pupil of charcot , he was head of the neurological clinic at hôpital de la pitié , 1890–1927 . ] 
babinski test  ||  noun a test for a babinski reflex 
baby  ||  noun a very young child who is not yet old enough to talk or walk babies start to walk when they are about 12 months old .  ( note :  if you do not know the sex of a baby you can refer to the child as it :  the baby was sucking its thumb ) 
baby blues  ||  plural noun same as postnatal depression ( informal ) 
baby care  ||  noun the act of looking after babies 
baby clinic  ||  noun a special clinic which deals with babies 
bacillaemia  ||  noun an infection of the blood by bacilli 
bacillary  ||  adjective referring to bacilli 
bacillary dysentery  ||  noun dysentery caused by the bacillus shigella in contaminated food

bacilluria  ||  noun the presence of bacilli in the urine 
bacillus  ||  noun a bacterium shaped like a rod ( note :  the plural is bacilli .  ) 
back  ||  noun 1 .  the part of the body from the neck downwards to the waist , which is made up of the spine and the bones attached to it ( note :  for other terms referring to the back , see dorsal and words beginning with dorsi -  , dorso -  .  ) 2 .  the other side from the front  she has a swelling on the back of her hand .   dorsum 
backache  ||  noun pain in the back , often without a specific cause comment :  backache can result from bad posture or muscle strain , but it can also be caused by rheumatism ( lumbago ) , fevers such as typhoid fever and osteoarthritis .  pains in the back can also be referred pains from gallstones or kidney disease .  
backbone  ||  noun a series of bones , the vertebrae , linked together to form a flexible column running from the pelvis to the skull .  also called rachis , spine 
background carboxyhaemoglobin level  ||  noun the level of carboxyhaemoglobin in the blood of a person who is not exposed to high levels of carbon monoxide 
back muscles  ||  plural noun the strong muscles in the back which help hold the body upright 
back pain  ||  noun pain in the back , especially long - lasting or severe pain 
backside  ||  noun someones buttocks ( informal ) 
back strain  ||  noun a condition in which the muscles or ligaments in the back have been strained 
baclofen  ||  noun a drug that relaxes skeletal muscles which are in spasm , either because of injury or as a result of multiple sclerosis 
bacteraemia  ||  noun the fact of having bacteria in the blood .  bacteraemia is not necessarily a serious condition .  compare septicaemia .   blood poisoning 
bacteria  ||  plural of bacterium 
bacterial  ||  adjective relating to bacteria or caused by bacteria children with sickle - cell anaemia are susceptible to bacterial infection .  
bacterial plaque  ||  noun a hard smooth bacterial deposit on teeth

bactericide  ||  noun a substance which destroys bacteria

bacteriolysis  ||  noun the destruction of bacterial cells 
bacteriolytic  ||  adjective referring to a substance which can destroy bacteria 
bacteriophage  ||  noun a virus which affects bacteria 
bacteriostasis  ||  noun the action of stopping bacteria from multiplying 
bacteriostatic  ||  adjective referring to a substance which does not kill bacteria but stops them from multiplying 
bacterium  ||  noun a microscopic organism .  some types are permanently present in the gut and can break down food tissue , but many can cause disease .  ( note :  the plural is bacteria .  ) comment :  bacteria can be shaped like rods ( bacilli ) , like balls ( cocci ) or have a spiral form ( spirochaetes ) .  bacteria , especially bacilli and spirochaetes , can move and reproduce very rapidly .  
bacteriuria  ||  noun a condition in which bacteria are present in the urine 
bactrim  ||  a trade name for co - trimoxazole 
bad breath  ||  noun same as halitosis ( informal ) 
baghdad boil  ||  , baghdad sore  ||  noun a skin disease of tropical countries caused by the parasite leishmania .  also called oriental sore

baker ( 1838–96 ) , member of staff at st bartholomews hospital , london , uk . ]

balanced diet  ||  noun a diet which provides all the nutrients needed in the correct proportions

baldness  ||  noun the state of not having any hair comment :  baldness in men is hereditary ; it can also occur in both men and women as a reaction to an illness or to a drug .  
balkan frame  ||  , balkan beam  ||  noun a frame fitted above a bed to which a leg in plaster can be attached .   pearson bed 
ball  ||  noun 1 .  the soft part of the hand below the thumb 2 .  the soft part of the foot below the big toe 
ball and cage valve  ||  noun an artificial heart valve , formed of a silicon ball which moves inside a metal cage to open and shut the valve 
ball and socket joint  ||  noun a joint where the round end of a long bone is attached to a cup - shaped hollow in another bone in such a way that the long bone can move in almost any direction .  compare ginglymus

balneotherapy  ||  noun the treatment of diseases by bathing in hot water or water containing beneficial natural chemicals 
balsam  ||  noun a mixture of resin and oil , used to rub on sore joints or to put in hot water and use as an inhalant .   friars balsam

barbotage  ||  noun a method of spinal analgesia by which cerebrospinal fluid is withdrawn and then injected back 
bare  ||  adjective with no covering bare area of the liver a large triangular part of the liver not covered with peritoneum

barium  ||  noun a chemical element , forming poisonous compounds , used as a contrast medium when taking x - ray photographs of soft tissue ( note :  the chemical symbol is ba .  )

barlows disease  ||  noun scurvy in children , caused by a lack of vitamin c [described 1882 .  after sir thomas barlow ( 1845–1945 ) , physician at various london hospitals and to queen victoria , king edward vii and king george v . ] 
barlows sign  ||  noun a test for congenital dislocation of the hip , in which a sudden movement is felt and sometimes a sound is heard when the joint is manipulated 
baroreceptor  ||  noun one of a group of nerves near the carotid artery and aortic arch , which senses changes in blood pressure 
barotitis  ||  noun pain in the ear caused by differences in air pressure , e.g.  during air travel 
barotrauma  ||  noun an injury caused by a sharp increase in pressure 
barr body  ||  noun a dense clump of chromatin found only in female cells , which can be used to identify the sex of a baby before birth [described 1949 .  after murray llewellyn barr ( 1908–95 ) , head of the department of anatomy at the university of western ontario , canada . ] 
barre - guillain syndrome  ||  noun guillain - barré syndrome 
barrel chest  ||  noun a chest formed like a barrel , caused by asthma or emphysema 
barrier cream  ||  noun a cream put on the skin to prevent the skin coming into contact with irritating substances 
barrier method  ||  noun a method of contraception in which the entry of sperm to the womb is blocked by a protective device such as a condom or diaphragm 
barrier nursing  ||  noun the nursing of someone who has an infectious disease .  it involves keeping them away from other patients and making sure that faeces and soiled bedclothes do not carry the infection to other patients .  ‘…those affected by salmonella poisoning are being nursed in five isolation wards and about forty suspected sufferers are being barrier nursed in other wards’ [nursing times] 
bartholinitis  ||  noun inflammation of the bartholins glands

basal metabolic rate  ||  noun the amount of energy used by the body in exchanging oxygen and carbon dioxide when at rest .  it was formerly used as a way of testing thyroid gland activity .  abbr bmr

basal nuclei  ||  plural noun masses of grey matter at the bottom of each cerebral hemisphere

basement membrane  ||  noun a membrane at the base of an epithelium

basic salt  ||  noun a chemical compound formed when an acid reacts with a base
